chargeHist.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin A Sorem was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.

Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless prescribed and taken only as prescribed.  

No bars, taverns, liquor stores or beer tents.  

No driving without valid DL or installation of IID.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

AODA and follow up.  

DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin A Sorem

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  3:28 p.m. 
INCLUDES 21CF1564, 22CF133 and 22CF668.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person/in custody from MCJ with Atty Dan Cveykus. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing and waiver of prelim in 22CF668.  

PRELIMINARY HEARING>>>
Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

21CF1564>>
State moves to DRI Count 1 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place/PTAC), Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor), Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor) and Count 5 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/PTAC); COURT GRANTS.

22CF133>>
State moves to DRI Count 2 (IID Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order/Repeater); COURT GRANTS. 

22CF668>>
State moves to DRI Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater), Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater) and Count 5 (Possession of Cocaine/Repeater); COURT GRANTS. 


PLEA>>
21CF1564 Count 2 (Possession of Methamphetamine/PTAC):  NO CONTEST. 

22CF133 Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater):  NO CONTEST.  

22CF668 Count 3 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place/Repeater):  NO CONTEST. 
22CF668 Count 4 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs/Repeater):  NO CONTEST.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on all counts:  SWH for 3 years probation; concurrent with each other.  CONDITIONS:  In 22CF668; COUNT 3 - 90 days MCJ; concurrent with any sentence currently serving.  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.  Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless prescribed and taken only as prescribed.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores or beer tents.  AODA and follow up.  60 days MCJ I/S for rules violations.  No driving without valid DL or installation of IID.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  COURT grants 10 days credit in 22CF668, 2 days credit in 21CF1564 and no credit in 22CF133.

Adj:  3:50 p.m.
Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.    Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  9:05 a.m. 
INCLUDES 21CF1564, 22CF133.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Dan Cveykus. 

Date and time set for initial appearance in 22CF133 and waiver of prelim in both cases;VRCW.  

22CF133>>>
Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J. 
Plea >> NOT GUILTY. 

21CF1564>>
Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J. 
Plea >> NOT GUILTY. 


INITIAL APPEARANCE in 22CF133>>

COURT ORDERS: $1500.00 signature bond.  

CONDITIONS: 
- No driving without valid DL. 
- Prints and photograph. 

Next Hearing >> Plea/sentencing hearing for 6/07/22 at 3:30 p.m. 

Adj: 9:09 a.m.
